The Bosch "Evolution" Bracketless wiper blade solves the problem of installation fitment with a convenient "cap" that lifts up to expose the wiper arm attachment point. Slip the blade onto the arm, close the cap, and you have a no-metal-parts, bridgeless, bracketless, full-contact wiper blade that resists freezing and "blow-off" at high speeds. Installation is easy due to the innovative design -- the hardest part of the replacement is getting the old blades off. Once you switch to the Evolution Blade, replacement is, literally, "a snap".I've tried 'em all -- Anco, Trico, RainX, etc., and these are the best wipers that I've ever used. Highly Recommended !!UPDATE: During a 1,150-mile trip to and through the mountains of Southern California, it was during a severe rainstorm that the Bosch Evolution Wiper Blades proved to be capable of performing perfectly under downpour conditons in the dark of night. Full, firm contact of the blades against the windshield gave a perfect wipe for every stroke -- we could all see through the windshield, but it was raining so hard that we couldn't see more than 100 feet ahead, anyways !!My daughter was so impressed with the Evolutions on my Grand Marquis, she ordered a 3-piece-set for her Land Cruiser -- from Amazon, of course !!Take a tip -- Check your wiper fitment carefully before ordering. The Land Cruiser mentioned above has a 20-inch blade on the Driver's side, a 21-inch blade on the Passenger's side, and a 16-inch blade on the Rear window.Modern windshield configurations have made different-size wiper blades common, so it all-ways pays to check.UPDATE #2 -- A 2,000-mile trip through the mountains of Arizona, Utah, Idaho, and Wyoming during the late-summer "monsoon" was the perfect test for the "Evolution" wiper blades -- with torrential rains, Nickle-sized hailstones, and severe winds combining to bring visibility to near-zero, the Bosch Evolution wiper blades ran quietly, wiped clean, and stayed streak-free through it all !!My order arrived promptly and in perfect condition. Thanks, Amazon !!

This leaves the best 'patina' so far on our exterior vinyl stripping. Eliminates water spots and brings out the reflective highlights without a greasy residue. Does not bleed off when wet either.Normally haven't had consistent results with any Meguiar's stuff, but Barry's got a home run with this.
This item will help keep your battery on full charge,and ready to go all the time, when used properly. Use in conjunction with the extender cord,(will let you park farther from the wall plug).

I have had this Prestone Bug Wash in my washer fluid reservoir for a few days now and I really like it.  I recently moved to the coast of southern Georgia, where there are a lot of bugs.  I was used to a lot of bugs having lived in rural Pennsylvania and Maryland, but some of the bugs down here are...messier...for whatever reason.  I also park under trees at the house and the office, and with the higher consistent temperatures, sap has become a real issue. I have noticed already that this bug wash does a great job of getting the sap off the windshield where the typical blue stuff I had been using tended to smear or do nothing to the windshield.  This bug wash gets it all off as far as I can tell.I am ordering another bottle for my wife's minivan!Note:  I was completely out of washer fluid when I put this in, so I am using it full strength right out of the bottle.  I cannot speak to its effectiveness if it is mixed with other washer fluids or water.Update 11.11.13I have used an entire reservoir on my car since I bought the first bottle, and I am buying more to replace it.  It continues to work well in getting off the sap and the bugs.  There are some drops of sap from a large pine tree in our yard that take a few tries to get off because they are so thick, but this Prestone Bug Wash does the trick.  I did add it to my wife's minivan after my initial review, topping off her tank, which had about a 1/4 of a reservoir left of the "blue" stuff.  It works well on the van, even diluted with normal washer fluid.  I still highly recommend this washer fluid if you are dealing with tree sap.  It works on bugs too, but I've noticed it more on the sap.

I got his because I was worried about people trying the winch switch not knowing what they were doing. But it is larger than I thought it would be. It sticks out much further than I thought it would. It makes it so the winch hook is the furthest this out in front of my quad and pulling it into my truck bed it would hit my tool box. It takes up the entire width between my vertical fairleads. If it was exactly half the size all the way around it would be great for ATVs but it looks like it's sized for a full size winch fairlead.If it didn't stick out so for, I would probably have kept it on. Yes, I could cut it down with a band saw, but... well I'm not sure why I didn't think of that until writing this... gotta go get the band saw out...
I bought this because Amazon suggested that it should be bought along with the brake controller. There is no need for it at all as the brake controller mounted just fine with the included hardware.
Good stand for the price. They hold my offroad rig at full extension on the frame no problem, and the double locking feature gives me peace of mind, but still be sure to use other safeguards.

after reading in consumer reports that this band & model was a top pick, I ordered one.  arrived & the package was half open but it looked ok so I kept it.  I like the half pound as u know your getting close when checking your tire pressure.  one thing about this gauge is you must keep a good seal or push on the valve firmly or its wont work.  it took me a few times to get it figured out.  now I know my tires are all the same PSI.  could recommend to a friend.

I wish our RV had the tank flush kit installed but it doesn't so I bought this.... It does the job well now that I know where to point it to hit the sensors... I flush the tank and use this every other week and it keeps my sensors working properly.

Gave them 5 stars!  Fit perfectly, look great, excellent Amazon price, and shipped fast!!My friend sold his Triumph Bonneville, and gave me a set of Formotion mini gauges - clock and thermometer.I bought these to mount the gauges to the handlebars on my Yamaha Roadstar.100% satisfied!

I bought this for my wife's Miata because the typical windshield wiper does not have enough curvature to meet the curve of the Miata's windshield. It does a better job than most but still does not curve enough at the very end.Since we get little rain in Reno, I haven't been able to test how effective it is in wiping off the rain but I will update this review when I find out.12/29/12 Update: With little rain here I can say that it seems to work as well as any other wiper blade. Because of our hot dry climat, blades don't last very long in Reno before becoming stiff and unable to flip over, thus squeaking. This blade is still doing O.K.

The 476 features carnauba wax AND normal wax together with some polymers to mall all work together. It's a really nice starters kit for a good wax layer that you can wait around 48h to have a second one applied.Collinite is not a very famous brand such as Meguiar's or 3M (actually the same since 2012) but they make awesome products. it's a bit more expensive that the OEM cabin filter, but the charcoal activated one seems to do a better job at keeping those exhaust fumes from entering the cabin. You know that situation- you have you AC or heat on fresh air, you're stuck in traffic, and soon enough, you smell the car exhaust from around you.  Since putting this filter in though, i have not noticed any smell of fumes, so while it's new at least, it does a great job of keeping your cabin air nice and clean.

I've had several tire pressure gauges over the years, the last two of which being digital.  The Michelin Gauge is a good, reasonably well built model that should last for years.Pros:-Well built-Long battery life-Easy to read-Relatively easy to mount on tireCons:-non-AA/AAA battery-Easy to lose too much air when fumbling around for a tire pressure indication

Exactly what I needed.  Packaged fine.  Came quickly of course with Amazon Prime.Using it to parallel wire batteries for inverters for short term electrical outages of 24 hours or less.Pleased with the product. Bought two sets.

The first thing I noticed about this charger is the sturdy construction and engineering.  It has separte plugs for clipping on to a battery or plugging it into your cigarette lighter plug.  It's simple to use either of these plug adaptions due to the unique lead adapter plug that comes off the 6 foot lead from the solar cell.  All you have to do is select the plug end you wish to use and plug that lead into the solar cell lead.  I had kept my RV plugged into the home electrical source to keep the battery charged.  I didn't know if this system would be able to keep my RV charged as I have a electronic mouse deterrant and a couple of alarm units that run off the battery.  They are small electrical draws but do tend to drain the battery quickly.  This solar battery charger has kept the RV battery fully charged.  I will recommend this solar charger to my friends and family.
Perfect fit and function on a 2003 BMW 325i - good buy, with Prime, its easy to plan purchase around oil changes
I got these with the intention of applying varnish and stain, but unfortunately they're too linty for this task.....but there are plenty of other applications that I'll be using them for.

As it turned out, only 1 front wiper blade was available for my car. So I took it as an opportunity to do a side-by-side between this wiper blade on one side of the windshield, and the dealer's stock wiper blade on the other.The Result?The side with the stock wiper blade streaked like crazy, while the side with this this Contour looked like it was squeegeed clean -- no streaks, no nuffin -- just a nice clear windshield.Why Contour?The name says it all -- the wiper blade's plastic spine is bendy, so the blade conforms perfectly to every car's unique curves and nuances. Perfect contact. Perfect wiping. No streaks. And nary a drop left behind. OH! So THIS is how wiper blades are supposed to work -- duh!Hands-down, my fave wiper blade. Now I just need to get a matching pair.

This towel is really great for drying your car.  I can do the whole car easily without needing to wring it out once. I still think it is great but if it was woven just a tiny bit tighter I think it would be that much better.  Still the best towel I have found for drying off my car, will buy another when this one is used up.

The price was right and it was delivered on time, however, it was not as durable as I imagined and was a little smaller than it looked to be in the picture.  It was also a little flimsy when extended to it's supposed maximum size.  I would not buy it again as my vents are larger and this is just not adequate for the intended purpose.  However, if the vents were not as wide, it would be acceptable.

These caps are great for underneath the tongue or jack stands.  As noted by a few other reviewers, they fade extremely fast.  A couple weeks outside and you can see the outline of whatever was resting on it.  Performance is not affected.

We really like our Zwipes.  When I first saw they were sending a pair I was thinking, "Great.  One to use, one to store."  But wait, I have two hands.  So now we use both at the same time.  I little dampness/polish or Endust and you can dust the home very quickly.  The Zwipe itself has a little bit of ionization so it will naturally attract dust but a little moisture really helps.  We shake them out to clean them and after about a month we'll wash them gently.  I highly recommend them.  If you have small hands or large blinds they work well for blinds.  I started keeping on in my car.

I put these in my car and ill say they are very bright!  I covered half of it with tape and that fixed the issue.  Th only problem with these is that the gauge is very high probably a 25 and is hard to work with when stripping the wires.  Other than that I am very satisfied.

The wash mitt is soft and holds a lot of wash water, which keeps the car well soaked. I've used the mitt twice now and have gotten scratch-free results both times. I've also washed the mitt twice and air dried it and it has come out soft and like new.

I use this on my race cars. It's fast and very simple to use. Plus, I don't need my reading glasses to read the scale. The digital readout is great. Seems to be fine and seems to be built well no problems so far and it does not restrict air or I would have not 5 stared this product. As far as Im concerned tekton products are good products for the price and also lifetime warranty. I own other tekton tools and have had no problems with them.

This cover fits my bike well and is very durable.  The generous size makes it easy to cover and remove, yet it has a snug fit as necessary to handle the wind.  Good product!

i HATED how every time i opened the door of my jeep i see dirt and what could possibly be scratches so i decided to buy the door sills and thank god i did first they look nice and look very OEM i don't know why jeep didn't just include them with the car but its a jeep.anyway they protect from dirt and scratches and they holding up pretty good. they came with double sided tape which so far is strong enough to keep it in place and i have passengers stepping on it almost everyday and i don't think its going anywhere.over all i am very happy with those and i do recommend it to anyone with a jeep

This scan tool couldn't be easier to use. Plug it in (in my 2012 Jeep Wrangler that's just under and to the left of the steering wheel), turn the ignition forward (but don't start the vehicle) and press enter on the scan tool. It will scan your vehicle in seconds and let you know how many error codes there are and what they are. It also gives you the ability to have the tool delete the codes from your vehicle's on board computer. Simple press of a button.It comes with a little book that tells you what all of the generic engine codes mean.I highly recommend the product.

It stays in place nicely, that was my main concern when buying.  It's a snug fit and my cap fits over it to hold into place.  Connections and snug and have had no problem.  A very simple, cheap and effective solution.

I purchased these as a gift for a friend for his Jeep Cherokee Classic. They installed easily and fit appropriately. I love Valeo brand and feel they're the best blades available-- better than some more expensive brands.

I'm a big big fan of all these products if you love your car and you want something non harsh to use on new paint or older cars this car wash stuff is what you need it soaps well and  along with the other products will give your car a high gloss and shine.

I'm just an average handyman kind of guy. There's not much around the house I can't do even when it comes to electricity. I can wire a house from ground up but I'm not an electrician. There are some things this meter can do that I'll never use or understand but for what I do know this will come in very handy and save me a boat-load of money. The sockets in two of my bathrooms were not working and I boiled it down to the breaker box. An electrician wanted a hundred and fifty bucks to change one breaker. For a fraction of the cost this meter helped me find the problem. (Breaker box not labeled properly by builder)I like the large digital numbers and solid construction of the meter. However I do not like the dark green and dark red print on the black face. It's almost impossible to read unless the light is very bright. Who thought dark print on dark was a good idea? Overall the meter works well, feels solid and comes with clear instructions. A good price through Amazon too.
Good.

Comes with enough oil to fill the tank.  Bought this to evacuate my car AC system after replacing a blown compressor.  Excellent product, very quiet.  Pulled a vacuum quickly and stabilized within 15 minutes, but let it run for 1.5 hours so that the moisture in the receiver/dryer would be removed. because, I have not used these yet.  I know they will be quite wonderful when I do need to use them

This is a very good product. I've used Meguiars and Mothers wheel cleaners, and this one works the best by far. Previous product have a lot of trouble getting the dirt and grime from around the nuts. This device was very easy to set up and pair with the app. I like how it judges my driving, although like other reviewers, I find the over-70 warning annoying and less useful than if it would warn for driving more than 10 over the speed limit or something more useful. Particularly since it continues to beep at you as you drive. But features like helping you get back to your car without having to remember to mark a parking location and info on engine warnings are particularly useful.However, I wish it would work without having to have your phone always paired and online. I don't have an always-on data plan so have to use my hot spot if I want to use the device while driving. With a limited data plan, it's annoying to have to use it while driving when otherwise I wouldn't normally have it on. So I use it a lot less while driving than I would otherwise.

I bought this to replace a missing lens on my camper.  My lights look like this one, and this full light assembly was about a buck cheaper than buying just the replacement lens.(plus if it is not the same size I could just put the new light on... and have a spare bulb...)Turns out it was not quite the same size.  But it was extremely close.With a little squeezing and pushing I got this lens to snap onto my old light.  It fits very tight so it should not blow off.Even though I didn't use the entire light, I can still say that it looks nice.All the parts of this light look well made.The lens is a nice clear color that really catches the light better than my old ones.If you don't want to drop the big bucks on LED marker lights then this one is a good way to go.
they work fine under the step to our rv.It keep the rv from moving when you step up to go in.

Best wash mitts of the ones I've tried. Perfect for those OCD folks like me. Two mitts in different colors mean you can use one for the dirty parts of the car (wheel wells, lower trim, etc.) while leaving the other for the parts you're really protective of (the hood, and body panels).Nice and soft. Holds a huge amount of water and suds making it easy to get the soapy water from the bucket to where you need it.I've had mine for a year or so and they seem to be holding up very well in the wash.Really great quality. Just what you would expect from Griot's.

After 2 months of heavy use these still go strong (no stripes). After a cold winter with lots of ice on a windshield every day I'd expect the rubber blade to deform but nothing like that has happened. Good product for the money.

You can't beat the price and there is more than enough for four big calipers. But taping everything is time consuming. I like the kind of caliper paint that comes in a can an use a brush. The short handle makes this easy to control and the soft bristles are made for finishing not scrubbing. Depending on the job a slightly stiffer brush should be a starter and this used for final cleaning of wheels that can stand the abrasion.

This was a perfect fit for the rear wiper of my Kia Soul. I did not find it at some of the local parts stores, but found it online and was pleased to see that it was an identical replacement for the OEM blade at a non-OEM cost.

I do a lot of brake and suspension work on my track car, and "Copper" Anti-seize is highly recommended as they have higher tolerant of heat than regular anti-seize. This 8oz. bottle will last you a life time if you only occasionally DIY on your vehicle.  For the price, this deal can't be beat....

I enjoy detailing my car.  Although I used many tire shine products, I wanted to find one that had the right balance between shind and protection.  Many of the tire shine products weaken the tire walls or interact with the rubber.  Others have "fling" and unable to hold the shine.  I found I needed to touch it up at least 1x per week.  This product is easy to apply and has held the "black" well for the past several weeks.  It isn't as shiny as other silicone based products but it also is safer for your tire.  I wanted a product that will keep my tire a dark black for at least a month.  This does it.
These look great on my rock lobster red wrangler! Really accents the front along with the matching headlight trim and mesh grill inserts. Super easy installation.

This is a wonderfully large and plush microfiber towel and a large sturdy squeegee.I'm not sure I have a great need for the the corner pockets, but the towel really is amazing. It's large and thick, and of course a great color, too.The squeegee is similarly impressive, large and sturdy.This is a great set. I think it would be especially nice as a gift, e.g., for a friend who just bought a new car.

I installed this on my Jeep XJ. Installation was straightforward. It made my stock headlights quite a bit brighter. Unfortunately, right after the first 30 minute drive I was standing in my driveway admiring how nice and bright the headlights were when POOF, the low beams just shut off by themselves, never to return. I turned on the high beams and they still worked, for about a minute and then they shut off, too. It's the relays - pure junk.  Good thing I was not out on the highway! To say I'm disappointed in this product is a big understatement. Only use it if you have a completely separate set of driving lights that you can switch on when these randomly shut off your lights. This is a real safety issue.

Charged my battery no problem. The lights on the charger let you know when the battery is at almost charged and turns green when it is completely charged. Worked well with my newly installed battery. For reference I used it one Yuasa battery and have had no problems so far. I took the battery out to charge it which seemed the easiest way to do it.
I needed this for the stabilizer on my camper. This works great and makes the process much easier. Made of heavy material and should last forever. Good price also.

You're not going to inflate a dirigible with it, but it gets the job done on my car and SUV tires.  It's very quiet compared to other compressor's I've owned in the 60s and 70s.  It comes with lots of extras that you can use to inflate balls (don't laugh).

I bought three bottles, all sprayed very poorly.  It came out in blotches, would not cover the tire well.  I had to take a sponge to spread it evenly on the tires.  The cleaning was not very good, better results with car wash suds.

After putting on the lift kit, Skyjacker shocks and bigger tires the Jeep definitely drove differently.  Has 170k miles on it and decided I might as well swap out the steering stabilizer as well.  Don't do a ton of off-road but enough that I figured it was time to change it out.  Noticed a huge difference immediately.  Steering feels much firmer, not tight, but firm and controlled.  Steering response also feels better, not as much "wiggle" so to speak when making turns of hitting big pot holes.  Overall very glad I purchased it.  Great product.  Rancho has always had a great reputation and now I can definitely see why.One thing to note.  The body is not as "white" as it appears in the picture.  It is more of a medium grey color. I have placed one of these on our 2002 Honda CR-V, and one on my 2012 Ford Fiesta. Both hitches went on very easy and instructions are great!  The only thing is the original muffler hangers allow the muffler to swing against the hitch (on both vehicles), causing a very annoying vibration and clunking sound. Haven't had a chance to use this grease gun but It looks to be perfect for the application I need it for.  It looks like it will be able to shoot lube up in some real tight places.  I am really excited to use this but I think I will stop before i get too graphic.  I am batman

Like other reviewers, I misunderstood the 'OE'/'UB' designations... I got OE for my wife's car, but they didn't fit. Luckily, my car was able to use them (although the current blades still have a bit of life left in them)... one wiper was a bit longer then what was on already, but it actually worked out better and cleared more of the windshield. Instructions are a bit too 'simple', as I think some who's never replaced wipers before might have trouble understanding them. I was able to get my bearings and figure out what was being explained. If you have ever tried to empty your black tank with a stock p00p tube then you will have an enormous amount of appreciation for the rhino hose kit. It is sturdy, it won't move on you once you pull the handle, and it has caps to seal in the freshness once you are done.The bad...like everyone else says, it will not fit in most standard p00p tube compartments. Now there is room for my fishing poles in my bumper :-)If you can figure out how to store it properly, I think that this is the best one on the market right now.
Plugs the hole and more!  Much nicer than the plastic plug.  Should be standard equipment on all campers and motor homes.
It leaves my car looking shiny and beautiful.  I wax my car twice a year and wash regularly with this and people are constantly asking if my 2007 car is brand new.
kinda cheezy. but it will get ths job done till it disentigrates from the sun and general exposure. cheap price.

great way to insulate those pocket of hot air in your camper. Also make it so you can take a nap anytime, in complete darkness compared to having an open vent with light streaming in.

Bought for my new Corvette.  Chevy sells a similar (if not the same0 product for a much higher price. The last is a pulsed maintenance mode so it can be kept on all the time for when the car will not be used for several weeks.  Well-made and comes with a bag to hold it and the accessories, that I put on a pegboard hook in the garage.

I bought these to supplement my existing leveling blocks for my 31' Class C motor home. They work as advertised and are one of those essential products that you hate to buy, but always need. For me, the bag is pointless but others may like it.

I like to use microfiber towels for cleaning largely because they are so soft and the microfiber seems to lift dirt so much better than other fabrics, even cotton, without scratching finishes.  So these Zwipe Microfiber Wash Mitts take that superior cleaning concept to the car wash.  The mitts have long microfiber fingers that increase surface area to retain moisture and suds while aiding in washing.  They slip on easily and have an elastic band at the wrist to help keep them on your hands.  You get two mitts for the price paid, so you can either wash with both hands for faster car washing or use the other mitt to dry your car (I found it works better than a chamois).  When they get dirty you can toss them in the laundry to get them clean as new.There is absolutely nothing to dislike about these mitts.  They absorb moisture well and make it easier to do detail cleaning of your car.  These mitts are obviously marketed for washing cars, but they could just as easily be used for fast and easy dusting at home.  They are clearly more expensive than a car wash sponge, but their versatility and function make their added cost very worthwhile.  Highly recommended.
Anyone looking to go to HID Xenon headlights these are the lights for you! It only took about 30 minutes to get them installed, and they are great!

After doing a lot of research on AGM batteries, I finally decided on this one.  This was a Birthday gift for my son, to be installed in his '03 Subaru Forester.I started out looking at the Optima Red Top, but the reviews were not as as good & people I know have had problems with their Red Top battery failing.  Now the choice was between the Sears DieHard Platinum & the Optima Yellow Top.The Sears DieHard Platinum looks like a very good battery & it's said to be made by Odyssey.  Not really sure thats true?  What pushed me over to the Optima Yellow Top was the heaver weight, much higher cost & shipping hassles if I went with the Sears DieHard Platium.The Optima Yellow Top was delivered quickly by UPS.  It comes in a heavy-duty, double walled cardboard box.  The battery inside the box was protected with more cardboard packing & the top of the battery was covered with a protective plastic cover.  With the attached removable lift handle, the battery was easy to remove from the shipping box.  The battery was in perfect condition!We found the Optima Yellow Top sits lower than a standard type 35 battery.  Not a problem, since a spacer is provided, which snaps onto the bottom of the battery.  This made the battery fit perfectly in my son's '03 Subaru Forester.  The battery comes fully charged, so once we hooked up the cables, the engine started right up!We would recommend this battery & the plan is to install one of these in our other 2 vehicles.► Update - October 23, 2012Since I wrote this review, I bought another Optima Yellow top for our '95 Neon Sport.  I should note that this isn't a direct replacement for the stock battery in the stock location!  We relocated the battery to the trunk & a sealed battery (less chance of gassing) was the way to go.  We completed this project over the summer & it was a complete success!As to the previous battery installed in the my son's '03 Subaru Forester.  It's been 100% trouble free! :)

I've owned a number of grease guns in my life, and have violently thrown every single one of them across the room at some point in time.  Whether it's a failure to prime, or leaking grease out the bottom, or bursting grease all over the place at the most inopportune times - they have all met the same, destructive fate.But not this one.  It primed quick and easy.  It delivered grease with ease.  It is the first grease gun that put more grease into the joint than on my hands.  Is this love?  I hope so...If you have felt the same pains that I have - stop wondering and get the last grease gun I hope to ever own.
These work as a 3156 backup light but not a 3157.  My 96 F350 needs 3157 for running, turn, and break lights.  These don't work.  I plugged them into my backup light 3156 and they did work.

Performed a test out in a nearby parking lot with my camper. Once placed under the tire, the item never slipped when the camper was pulled up onto the item. They are wide enough not to be concerned about the tire slipping off the side of the item.

Bought these for emergency situations since they're suppose to be very portable. They fold up nice and small and are prefect for storage. So far they work as advertised, downside is that It can be real fun removing them once the car is back on the ground. The tires naturally roll a tiny bit on one of them once lowering. I did not purchase the nufinish from amazon but was compelled to leave a review.  I am relatively new to car care.  I started using mothers and meguiars through advice from friends.  Although the shine of those products was appealing, the labor used to constantly update the shine on my car was a deterrent.  After perusing forums and always seeing the orange bottle on the shelves of car care stores I decided to purchase a bottle and try it out on my girlfriends car.  Her silver metallic vw golf that is left out in the hot and salty hawaiian sun was in dire need of protection.  All I did was wash the car with meguiars NXT car wash, given to me free from a fried leaving the island, and then I applied the nufinish.  It was a benefit to be able to apply the polish in the sun.  The polish went on as easy as any wax that i've used, just make sure to use a damp applicator as many people have noted.  Removal was just as easy, using a microfiber cloth I removed all the polish and what was left behind was a beautifully shining vw golf.  I even surprised my gf, when she saw the car she was really impressed.I then tried the polish on my pearl white 2010 RD and was equally impressed with the results.  I even applied the polish to all of the windows, which was easier than applying rain-x.  Also, I applied the polish to my rims and that made them sparkle.  All I can say is that I'm a convert.  To me, the shine is just as good as a carnauba wax and should hold up much longer.  Even if it lasts only half a year, that's much longer than what carnauba can do.Reading the forums on car care, you read a lot of people bash nufinish because it's cheap, those people can pay whatever they want for high priced waxes that last for 2 months at most.  I'll stick with nufinish to protect my vehicles.Next up, my mother's SL550, and maybe my next outrigger canoe

I think C. MacPhail already said it all. I'll try not to be too redundant.This gauge has a nice large read-out, a back-lit screen, and a light built in to help align things in the dark, all of which are great. A downgrade comes in because of simple problems, like the light switch activating inside the case and subsequently discharging the batteries, rendering the gauge useless when you need it. If you plan to have one in each vehicle, then the single car memory isn't an issue, but I prefer to leave the gauge in the garage for all to share so a single memory function is of little value to me. I gave it 3 stars simply because if one is willing to be extra careful with the light switch when storing, is happy with only one memory function, and is willing to take the time to learn how to correctly align the gauge and put up with the sensitive seal, then it is at least nice to have such an easy-to-read display. There are better designs out there, though, and C. MacPhail's review provided a couple. My favorite Topeak D2 SmartGauge is a bit pricey but it works very well for Presta valves (many bikes) as well as the more common Schrader valve found on cars and other bikes. It's accurate up to 250 psi, has a swivel head, and it's very small (about half the size of this gauge.

I got these for my 2005 GMC Yukon to replace the dome and rear map lights. For the dome light, they work perfectly! The map light is a bit more complicated. It appears GMC puts resistors in the rear map lights to reduce the intensity of the map lights. This is really a good idea because if your rear passengers turn on the lights in the back, it will impair the drivers ability to see the road. The tings is, while this does dim the LED lights, they are not as forgiving to the dimming effect and are simply not putting out enough light. Because the lights is so directed from these SMD LED lamps, I don't think they would interfere with the driver. I plan on removing the resistor to get a bit more output from these. That is a project for a future day. Until then, they work GREAT in the dome area.NOTE: Unlike standard incandescent lights, LED lamps are polarity sensitive in DC systems. If you install these and they dont work, turn them around.

I bought this as a kitchen thermometer. I am on a quest to make perfect pancakes and could never keep my griddle at the perfect pancake temperature (360 F). I made the best batch of pancakes in my life after using this thermometer to adjust the surface temperature just so. And this morning, I made the best omelet I've ever cooked (at 325 F).I chose this model as it claims to have better accuracy than comparably priced competitors (1.5%, or 1.5C (3F) whichever is greater). This might not be good enough for medical applications, but for cooking, car repair, or home heating uses it's pretty good. Also, it claims a narrower beam than other products with a 10:1 distance to radius ratio, allowing more accurate scans at a distance. And, supposedly, one standard 9V battery will last 12 hours of use, which given that a single scan is typically 5 seconds might as well be for a lifetime.I've been quite happy with this product. I like the scan feature, where you can scan over an area keeping track of the hottest temperature. It's also nice that the optics are well shielded deep inside the device, making it unlikely I'll get fingerprints on them, and allowing me to stuff it in my pocket if needed.  And, I like the laser guide, which my son uses to play Buzz Lightyear (I'm very careful to not let him point it at his or my eyes).I'm so happy with this product, I'm thinking of giving them out as Christmas gifts this year.

I'll start off by saying I am a professional Detailer at a high end shop in Kapolei Hawaii.  I wax every single car I do by hand and I needed a better pad then ones I used before I purchased these. If you're going to take the time to detail your vehicle purchase these pads they make your life easier and the wax portion of the detail is more enjoyable.

California 2000 V6 Camry with P1150 and P1155. Two of my code tables show as Bank 1 Sensor 2 A/F sensor so I ordered the Denso 234-4209 O2 sensor. Came in on time and package well protected but looks like its the wrong one - my fault, somewhat. Turns out, as far as I could tell, my two tables from two different sources had it backwards as it should be Bank 2 Sensor 1 A/F and Denso/Amazon order check didn't help much either.Anyway, Bank 2 Sensor 1 is the one on the engine right front (easy to get to) where Denso refer as Upstream Front. I gave it 5 stars base on previous experience, will order this one later.Why the a few of you refer as Bank 1 Sensor 1 and still corrected the check engine light? That would not be this one for the the Toyota V6 but Denso 234-9007 where they refer as Upstream Rear. Am I wrong?Seems like I'm not the only one confused based on superceeded information on P1150 and P1155.This one is for Bank 2 Sensor 1 for the Toyota V6 engine (mine is the 1MZFE).

These make the clunky, wind-up "blind" style obsolete.Don't be discouraged if, initially, when popped out of their bag, they are reluctant to stick well on the glass. It takes a little time for them to relax, stretch out and flatten. Once in place, they are easily peeled off and repositioned.The absolute best feature is how, when accidentally lowering the rear window, they "snap" away from the glass as the window starts to make its way down, alerting you to your mistake. Then when winding the window back up, they reattach themselves in place - brilliant.

If you do your own car cleaning and detailing, you know you will go through a lot of microfiber towels (tip #1- normal used cotton towels are too scratchy, especially for interior work). These are also a must for any cleaning work on LCD screens (like your TV, Computer Monitor and Navigation screen in many cars).  And you can never have too many, especially once your significant other finds out about how soft they are.  So no worries, just throw another stack of 10 into your next Amazon order and you're good to go.  Tip #2, once these are dirty keep them separate from your other laundry and only wash them with other microfiber towels. Tip #3, I keep a fresh one in my car's driver door storage bin at all times, as they do a great job of cleaning the haze off of the interior glass between detailing sessions.  Plus if you have a coffee accident, the towel is right there to bail you out.So good quality microfiber towels in a ten pack, at a low Amazon price- recommended.

excellent product, i tried several products on my rims, this really does the job well, i sprayed it liberally to rims wells and outside used brush only on inside wells , but didn't have to brush the outside of the rim, and the rim became  totally clean with just water hose rinse, strong but yet no complications from the product, what i mean is that i noticed its safe on the rims.the only disadvantage is that the bottle was enough for one time clean only, so for proper clean i think you needs 2 bottles, if you want to clean properly including the wells behind the spokes.

We bought these to use with our new washing machine.  The braided "FloodSafe" hoses do not bend (& you should make sure they DO NOT BEND) & so take up more space behind the machine.  These 90 degree elbows solve that problem.  We've had them on for 2 months now & no leaks at the connection.Be careful not to overtighten; that can destroy the threads & cause leaking.

This stuff is the best example I can think of, of a product that not only works but far exceeded my expectations.  As one reviewer mentioned, it will cause wintertime ice to easily flake off.  Ditto for summertime bug removal.  It repels rain so well that it is a viable alternative to doing an expensive windshield wiper mechanism repair (for those of us that drive old cars).  I work as a highway patrolman (er . . patrolperson) for a living, and quickly learned that windshield wipers tend to lift off of the windshield when when having to drive at 80-90+.  No problem with Rain-X as this is where it works best -- aided by the wind to blow your windshield clear.  MANY TIMES I have driven to a call at high speed, in blinding downpour rain, with my wipers turned off and seeing perfectly (and enjoying my coffee), while other traffic is stopped on the shoulder or crowded in under bridge overpasses (I still can't figure out the purpose of that) due to no visibility. And I find that it lasts for several weeks on a car that is not garaged.  My highest recommendation.  Three thumbs up!  Oops - make that two thumbs up.

My husband and I both have these ice scrapers in our cars.  They are fantasic! I'm obliged to switch regularly between 1-7/8" and 2" balls on my hitch, and the Reese Interlock hitch balls make the swap a one-handed operation with the Reese Towpower hitch. That may not seem significant, but in inclement weather it allows you to hold an umbrella or tarp for protection and complete the swap with your remaining hand, in comparative comfort; the first time you have to change a ball in the rain, sleet or snow will sell you on one-handed swaps.

This is a universal sensor and you need to connect the connector.  It is pretty tricky to do the connection.  I used the clamping method as suggested but found that the connection is not tight as I just used a regular wiring clamping tool.I tried to solder but it failed as the material of the wire did not accept soldering.  Finally, I used a crossed twisted method to join the wire itself and then wrap it by thin copper wires and then solder the wrap.  The joint is very tight and I cannot pull it apart.  Replace it in the vehicle, it works fine and no more check engine light.

I use these valves on all our vehicles and put one on any new vehicle we acquire. This valve is not much bigger than the oil pan plug. If clearance is an issue for off road like in my 4x4 vehicles, I make sure it is either tucked/hidden nicely by factory design or I add an engine skid plate to protect the valve as well as the oil pan and transmission. I have not had any issues with 6 of these valves over many miles. Comes in handy to get a quick sample for oil analysis as well. No muss no fuss. I like to use the valve to drain the oil directly into an old used 5 quart oil jug and then drop it off at the oil collection depot. No need for a hose off the valve either. Great product!
Pure ONE are the best filters on the market especially used with synthetic oil. Great price here on Amazon, have bought many Pure one's here

The strap looked like it stretched just a bit - a little is okay (even good) - but the strap is in great shape and now I won't look like the goofy guy with the brand new strap when I go to use it in the future! I first bought one of those little yellow hitch ball locks and realized that a good sledge hammer could take it off in one crack. So, I ordered this one and found it to be super hard, super heavy and super cool. The keyhole has a dust cover to keep the keyhole free of dirt and moisture. And it will take more than one whack to knock it off. The thief will simply move onto another trailer that's easier to steal. It was much cheaper here on Amazon, too, and free shipping and no tax. An overall good savings.
I put these in my '03 TJ Jeep Wrangler.  They fit perfect and work exactly as you'd expect they should.  I installed a set of 55w HIDs in them and the light output is tremendous.

These work great!  Just unwrap and place it inside the vent.  The insulating qualities weren't important for us - just the ability to block out the morning lite in the bedroom.  Absolutely does the job.  Stays in place without a worry.  We've traveled with these in place and they don't fall out. Only drawback is you have to be able to reach the vent and pull them out if you want light - and then have a place to "store" or place them afterwards.  We'd definitely buy again, and if they last just 4-5 years we'll buy some replacements.
Arrived as expected. I had this tool before and broke it and this is the replacement. Does a good job flushing out the particles in the bottom of the water heater.
Nice easy to use pads. Worked as expected from the first use. easy to use and large enough to get the job done.
My only complaint would be that the leads (wires) are pretty short, although I understand the reasons for making them that way.Appears to be sufficiently accurate and is very easy to use.

These are decent, middle-of-the-road wipers. The rubber is heavy and seems like it will be durable. My old blade (a Michelin...looks almost identical) had started chattering and leaving a huge streak. Replacing it with this blade fixed the problems, but I suspect most new wipers would have. I did notice streaks near the edges of the blade, though, so this wiper isn't leaving as wide of a clear path as it should.If you have a car with "opposing" wipers (rather than both going in the same direction, they move towards each other, both attached at the lower corners), you will have to remove and rotate the attaching bracket in order to keep the "spoiler" on the top edge (this is illustrated in the instructions) on your passenger side.  A bit of a hassle, but not a huge deal.The price seems a little steep, currently $13.53 here, with a MSRP of an astounding $28! I can tell you these are DEFINITELY not worth $28. As $14 wipers, I would give these about 3.5 stars.  For $28, I would expect something really special, which these are not.  They are just okay.  For $28 wipers, I'd only give them two stars.Note: When I ordered these, it appeared that they would fit my Chrysler, but they do not (I needed the UB, rather than the OE, version).  My wipers have a J-shaped hook, and none of the adapters included with this version will work with that.  I did get the UB version as well, which, aside from the connection point, are identical to these.

I've been using this to trickle power to my marine batteries and it seems to work quite well. I did a lot of research on this topic a while ago and found out that as long as you have 5W or less (this one is 2.5W) then you do not need a charge controller to maintain the battery.BatteryMINDer Charger-Desulfator - 12 Volt, AGM Batteries, Model# 2012-AGM, which I use when my batteries are mostly run down. I use the solar charger and the BatteryMINDer with the 12V GEL Marine batteries that I use for my RV (I used to also have a boat and trolling motor). Anyways, one cool feature about the solar charger is that if I run the battery all the way down, the BatteryMINDer does not recharge it. It reports an error condition. However, if I put the solar panel trickle charger on that same battery for a day, then I can use the BatteryMINDer to fully recharge the battery. I imagine that the solar panel would eventually fully recharge the battery too, but I haven't actually tested that. Still, the solar charger is a good way to keep your batteries in good shape and topped off.

I have used my share of waxes and polishes on my vehicles and this is by far the best I have seen. It goes on very easily and comes off the same. No white stuff in the seams or on the black trim! The only product I've seen last a bit longer outside is the Harley Glaze, but you have to deal with the white caught in the seems etc. Highly Recommended.

This device provides a significant bit of added safety in your car. In the very unlikely event where you have an accident that disables the doors and power windows, you can use this tool to break a side window. The built in spring hammer will break tempered glass. The windshield is laminated glass and the tool can not break that. If you can't escape because your seat belt is jammed, the built-in cutter will let you cut the belt so you can get out. These functions could save your life. I was unable to test either function since I don't want to break any of my car's windows or slice a seat belt.There is also a little LED flashlight and LED red blinker. The manufacturer claims these could be helpful in an emergency. The flashlight is not very bright, but could help you find your keys if you drop them. The flasher is also rather dim and I can't think of any situation where I would want it. There is also an audible alarm. This alarm is pretty loud and could scare off a potential assailant.You can get a visor clip for the tool that will put it in easy reach in an emergency. That is what I plan to do. All in all, this is a very helpful lifesaver for a reasonable price. I gave it four stars instead of five because it really is too big for me to use on my key chain.

This is such a useful tool when doing brake jobs. Simply place the tabs in between the pads and twist to push the pistons back. There is no need for positioning a C clamp or using vice grips and an extra set of hand to squeeze the pistons back.

My 2007 Toyota FJ Cruiser's stock horn was, well, pretty pathetic.  A single horn that wasn't very loud and would easily get lost on the highway - and it's amazing how many people are unable to see that bright yellow SUV so a horn that works is cruicial to my survival.  The PIAA horns dropped in with very little work - the FJ is wired for a second horn, so all you need are a couple of electrical tips, about 3 feet of copper wire, and a 10mm bolt and you can put the pair of these in front of your radiator where they'll do the most good - most other cars, I suspect, will have similarly easy installations.  The difference in volume was immediately noticeable.  They're not train horns, and they won't make your ears bleed, but they're appropriately loud car horns that install easily.

Other raters claim they are "super bright" and some complained about being too bright. They are white light as opposed to the warmer colored incandescent and in a side-by-side comparison they do not cast the same volume of light. I replaced all my RV lights and it feels dimmer inside compared with the stock lights.  Mind you they cast sufficient lighting and the wattage saving for dry camping is significant and they are cool to the touch.  However, if you are a full-hook up camper and don't NEED the wattage savings I wouldn't bother with the expence.  They are polorized so installing them is side specific therefore it's a 50-50 chance you have to rotate them on the install.  The volume of light issue rates them an okay and so far they are all working well. The price online is much cheaper than at Camping World or other retailers who want $10-$15 each!  Try a set on your "most used lights" first to see for yourself if you like the look before you invest in a total switch over to LED.

The Meguiar's buffer system takes a lot of getting used to because these pads are hook and loop attachment.  The hook and loop (Velcro) is not very strong, and it is glued to the foam.  This means 2 things...  the pads will fly off and have to be constantly re-centered and reattached while you're working.. and once they get hot the glue lets go and then you need a new pad.  This is very poor design for a buffer system that costs $150 for the tool and $0 per pad.  If you can get past those limitations, you will get a well buffed car.

I was away on business during a huge ice storm throughout the Philadelphia suburban region.  My wife called and told me that we had no power... along with about 700k other people.  After reading several reviews, I ordered this WEN 3500W generator via Amazon Prime, shipped overnight.  I flew home the next morning and found the generator waiting in my driveway.Setup was simple.  You need to attach the wheels and handles, fill with oil, fill with gas, and start her up.  Started on the first pull despite sitting out in below freezing weather all day.  I let the generator warm up for about 5 minutes, plugged in a lamp to test, and everything worked as expected.  I then connected a power cord to my oil furnace (disconnecting power cables in junction box between furnace and circuit breaker panel), plugged it in to the generator, and restored heat to the house.Over the next few days, I also hooked up several lights, our alarm clocks, our FiOS equipment, laptops, and phone chargers.  No issues.  I did not try the 240V connection.  There is not enough power to run my electric dryer or water heater, so I found no real need for 240V.  I didn't run my fridge because it was already too late -- I didn't get the generator hooked up until about two days after we lost power -- but I would hook up the fridge in the future.The power company finally restored power to our house about 50 hours after we first hooked up the generator.  We ran for a total of 35 to 40 hours.Some other things you might be interested to know:- I used Mobil 1 10W30 and changed the oil after the first night.  I have an oil extractor to "suck" the oil out, but you could probably drain by tipping the generator on it's side.  An oil extractor is clean and easy.- The generator ran my oil furnace for over 10 hours on a single tank.  The tank was near empty when I refilled, but 10+ hours is more than I expected.- The tank is labeled 4 gallons, but it seems to only take about 2.5 gallons.  (The tank was near empty when I refilled, and it was only 2.5 gallons.)- Put Stabil in your gas can before filling the generator.  I use Stabil in my gas cans for my lawnmower, tractor, leaf blower, weed whacker, jet ski -- it really helps avoid carb issues.- Plug things in after the generator is running, and unplug things before you shut it down.  I don't know if I would have an issue if I left things plugged in, but I don't want to find out.- Buy a few extension cords.- Generator makes noise, but we were able to sleep without issue.  My wife commented that it wasn't as loud as she expected.- Get a carbon monoxide detector and put it in the room closest to the generator.  We had no issues.Bottom line: Three hundred bucks to bring my house back to life was money well spent.  We are ready for the next ice storm, hurricane, or whatever surprise happens next.  We can run our furnace and fridge.  We will have lights.  I am happy with this purchase and would buy again.  You get much more for your money buying for Amazon than buying from the local big box store when everyone else is looking for a generator.

I bought this plug to use in conjunction with a new block heater I installed on my car. I dont know about you, but i hate the dangling block heater cord on the front of cars, not to mention if you dont seal it back up, the plug rusts. I used this to hide the cord inside my bumper. I drilled a hole up under the lower air dam, and installed it there. Now i just reach up under the front bumper, flip open the very sealed cover, and put in the extension cord. When you unplug the extension cord in the morning, you just flip the seal back closed and you cant see anything. Clean looks, tight weather sealing, simple.
